Package com.gmail.mohitsainiknl2.util.debug

Class Assertion

java.lang.Object
com.gmail.mohitsainiknl2.util.debug.Assertion
public class Assertion
extends java.lang.Object
Assertion class is designed to help the developer in debugging process, This class print the message to Output-Stream if the assertion is enabled for the project which uses this.
To enable Assertion :
Command-Prompt :
"java -ea -jar MSCalculator.jar" should do it on the command prompt.

VS Code :
goto- "Run and Debug(Ctrl + Shift + D)" >> On top drop-down menu select "Add Configuration"
Then, (new launch.json file will open),
Add(with quotes), "vmArgs": "-enableassertions" , under the Configurations section.
and, Save the file.

OR
goto the link- "https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54024007/how-to-enable-java-assertions-in-visual-studio-code"

Eclipse :
goto- Run >> Run_Configurations >> Java_Applications(left_sidebar) >> MainLauncher >> Arguments
Then, type "-ea" or "-enableassertions" under VM Arguments section
Click, Apply and Run.

OR
goto the link- "https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5509082/eclipse-enable-assertions"

IntelliJ :
goto the link- "https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18168257/where-to-add-compiler-options-like-ea-in-intellij-idea"
Author:
Mohit Saini

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private static boolean checkAssertionEnabled()
    checkAssertionEnabled method check if the assertion is enabled of not.
    private static void printErrorMessage​(java.lang.Throwable obj)
    printErrorMessage method help to print both message and location of error, with the help of obj.
    private static void printMessage​(java.lang.String message)
    printMessage method is the fastest way, here, to print the message, if it fails to print the message, it will call the printMessage2ndWay method.
    private static void printMessage2ndWay​(java.lang.String message)
    printMessage method is the Second fastest way, here, to print the message, if it fails to print the message, it will call the printMessage3ndWay method.
    private static void printMessage3rdWay​(java.lang.String message)
    printMessage method is the common way to print the message
    static void throwErrorMessage​(java.lang.Throwable obj)
    throwErrorMessage method print both the message and the location of thrown (if Assertion is enabled).
    static void throwMessage​(java.lang.String message)
    throwMessage method only print the message on the Output-Stream, not the location of thrown (if Assertion is enabled).

  • Method Details

    • throwMessage

      public static void throwMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      throwMessage method only print the message on the Output-Stream, not the location of thrown (if Assertion is enabled).
      Parameters:
      message - this is the message to be print.

    • throwErrorMessage

      public static void throwErrorMessage​(java.lang.Throwable obj)
      throwErrorMessage method print both the message and the location of thrown (if Assertion is enabled). Because, this method will execute on condition, Like - if( !(_assertion_condition_) ) Assertion.throwErrorMessage(new Throwable(_assertion_message_)); so, if developer's assumption is false about the assertion-condition , this will inform the developer about his wrong assumption in the debugging or testing process (where assertion is enabled).
      Parameters:
      obj - this object help to find the thrown-location of the error-message.

    • checkAssertionEnabled

      private static boolean checkAssertionEnabled()
      checkAssertionEnabled method check if the assertion is enabled of not.
      Returns:
      true if assertion is enabled, otherwise false.

    • printErrorMessage

      private static void printErrorMessage​(java.lang.Throwable obj)
      printErrorMessage method help to print both message and location of error, with the help of obj.
      Parameters:
      obj - this contains the information about error-message to be thrown.

    • printMessage

      private static void printMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      printMessage method is the fastest way, here, to print the message, if it fails to print the message, it will call the printMessage2ndWay method.
      Parameters:
      message - this is the message we need to print.

    • printMessage2ndWay

      private static void printMessage2ndWay​(java.lang.String message)
      printMessage method is the Second fastest way, here, to print the message, if it fails to print the message, it will call the printMessage3ndWay method.
      Parameters:
      message - this is the message we need to print.

    • printMessage3rdWay

      private static void printMessage3rdWay​(java.lang.String message)
      printMessage method is the common way to print the message
      Parameters:
      message - this is the message we need to print.
